article.headline: Northwestern St. 67, Cent. Arkansas 66
article.story: CONWAY, Ark. (AP) -- Playing in its fourth overtime game this season, Central Arkansas couldn't pull out a win Saturday against Northwestern State, falling 67-66 after going scoreless for the last 3 1/2 minutes of the extra period. The Bears (13-10, 3-6 Southland Conference) forced overtime on a jumper by Marcus Pillow with 13 seconds remaining. In the extra period, Colby Bargeman scored in the lane with a second remaining to take the win for the Demons (10-13, 6-3). Nate Bowie led Central Arkansas with 17 points. Pillow added 14, York Sims chipped in 12 and Durrell Nevels had 10 points and 11 rebounds. Brian Marks had a career-high 17 rebounds. Bargeman and Trey Gilder each had 14 points for Northwestern State -- and Gilder had 14 rebounds as well. Keithan Hancock added 12 for the Demons. Last weekend, Central Arkansas topped Nicholls State 98-96 in double overtime.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
